value.0: The dwarf eyes you calmly as you approach. "Tis good that the keep has answered our cry for help. We were worried that with all the troubles, ye might not be willing to come."
"You are impatient, <lad/lass>. It was our dark cousins' impatience over the distribution of gold that led to their betrayal of our kin. For that, we have never forgiven them."
"Aye, tis the one language we all understand, that of wealth. I tell ye truly, it was the gold that led to our dark cousins betrayal of our kin, and for that we have never forgiven them."
"Aye, and the Archenland Clan will always remember it. We dwarves have long memories, which is why we have never forgiven our dark cousins for their betrayal."
"But what is more to the point is that they have never forgiven us either, which brings us to our present troubles. Let me ask ye, what is your knowledge of our duergar cousins?"

"That may be true, but it is important to note that they usually don't take orders from mages. The duergar are suspicious of the mystical arts, particularly since the dark elves are usually more powerful mages."
"Then ye probably already know that they usually don't take orders from mages. The duergar are suspicious of the mystical arts, particularly since the dark elves are usually more powerful mages."
"Well, let me tell ye, they usually do not take orders from mages. The duergar are suspicious of the mystical arts, particularly since the dark elves are usually more powerful mages."
"So it was quite unnerving when the duergar crept up into our hall one night and suddenly fireballs and other spells began to fly. Whoever the mage is, he was quite powerful."
"Powerful enough to have taken charge of those who usually hate magic. The rest of my kin and I could drive out the dark dwarves, if you can kill that pesky mage for us."
"As I told that strange fellow, The Stan, if you want to save us the trouble of killing all our cousins, we'll give ye a magical weapon in return."
"But you still get paid, either way. 'Tis up to you."
"Not worth it, thinks Trip. Get in, kill the mage, get out. That is the plan we should follow."
"Ah, music to my ears. Any magic weapon made by dwarves is something I take a keen interest in."
"When ye enter the mine, go to the east and then south. There is a cave with a lever in it that opens the door down to our hall. I imagine the foul mage has made himself comfortable in there."
"Very well. I shall return to me kin and tell them to get ready to take our home back. Just tell The Stan when ye be finished. Best of luck to ye."
"Just give me the details I need to help you."
"You offered gold. I need gold. Everybody's happy."
"<FullName> always helps an ally."
"They bleed and die, which is all I need to know."
"I couldn't care less about them."
"I know plenty about them."
"I know little about them."
"And if I kill all of the duergar?"
"Where would I find this mage?"
"I'll be going then."

Comment.value: dwarf walks away and destroys self
